Key Match Events: Anthony Davis and LeBron James led a second-half comeback for the Lakers.
LeBron James posted a triple-double with 19 points, 10 rebounds, and 16 assists.
Anthony Davis, the league's leading scorer, scored 19 points before leaving the game due to an injury.
Austin Reaves led the game in scoring with 27 points.
RJ Barrett led the Raptors with 18 points.
All five Raptors starters plus Chris Boucher scored at least 12 points each.
Pre-Game Insights: Anthony Davis held the league lead for scoring at 32.4 points per game.
The Lakers had a 5-4 record and were fighting to stay in the playoff picture.
The Raptors were 2-8 and had dropped three straight games.
Toronto was missing four key players and was on the fourth night of a five-game road trip.
Post-Match Reflections: Coach Darko Rajakovic called a timeout with 1:40 left, and the benches were put in.
The Raptors' effort was noted despite their exhaustion and lack of talent compared to the Lakers.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at Crypto.com Arena.
The Raptors led 34-26 after the first quarter.
The Lakers went on a 19-8 run after Anthony Davis left the game due to injury.
The final score was 123-103 in favor of the Lakers.
